intro: Diodia macrophylla var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody with age, while its leaves are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils.
